extendedIngredients.name: canned pinto beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (15-ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (4 ounces) preshredded reduced-fat Mexican blend or cheddar cheese

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup (2 ounces) grated fresh Parmesan cheese, divided

extendedIngredients.name: yam bean
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (15-ounce) can black bean, rinsed and drained

recipes.title: Southwestern Lasagna

winePairing.pairingText: Lasagne on the menu? Try pairing with Montepulciano, Sangiovese, and Chianti. Lasagna pairs well with medium-bodied red wine with higher acidity. Sangiovese, Montepulciano, and Chianti all fit the bill. One wine you could try is Buccicatino Montepulciano d. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Buccicatino Montepulciano d
productMatches.description: Dark chocolate and raspberries, harmonious, great palate authority

recipes.instructions: Place a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat until hot. Add onion, and cook for 3 minutes. Add salsa, cumin, half the garlic, corn, and beans.Place ricotta in a food processor, and process for 1 minute or until smooth. Add remaining garlic, cream cheese, ¼ cup Parmesan, and egg white; pulse 2 to 3 times.Spread ¾ cup bean mixture in the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Arrange 3 noodles over the bean mixture, and top with 1 cup ricotta mixture, ¾ cup bean mixture, and ¼ cup Mexican cheese. Repeat layers, ending with noodles. Spread remaining bean mixture over noodles, and sprinkle with ¼ cup Parmesan. Cover with foil; store in refrigerator up to 24 hours.Preheat oven to 375°.Bake, covered, at 375° for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with ¼ cup Mexican cheese, and bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes.

steps.step: Place a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat until hot.
Add onion, and cook for 3 minutes.
Add salsa, cumin, half the garlic, corn, and beans.
Place ricotta in a food processor, and process for 1 minute or until smooth.
Add remaining garlic, cream cheese, ¼ cup Parmesan, and egg white; pulse 2 to 3 times.

Spread ¾ cup bean mixture in the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Arrange 3 noodles over the bean mixture, and top with 1 cup ricotta mixture, ¾ cup bean mixture, and ¼ cup Mexican cheese. Repeat layers, ending with noodles.
Spread remaining bean mixture over noodles, and sprinkle with ¼ cup Parmesan. Cover with foil; store in refrigerator up to 24 hours.Preheat oven to 375°.
Bake, covered, at 375° for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with ¼ cup Mexican cheese, and bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
